intro: Anigosia, commonly known as the "scented shrub," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. The plants typically have aromatic leaves and small, yellowish or white flowers that bloom in clusters. They are often found in rocky or dry soils and are valued for their ornamental appeal. Anigosia species are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
